page.title: 10FARMING IN CHALFORD
page.content: There are several different types of farm in this area.Daisy Court Farm is a pig farm which has six hundred and seventy pigs.The pigs eat five tons of barley every week and drink two lorry loads of milk. Westley Farm is towards Cirencester, they have five horses and twenty-five cows which are fattened for beef.The animals are fed on hay,milk,mixed corn and barley.It costs quite a lot of money to run the farm.They also have six hens and one cockerel. Another farm is called Upper Hill farm.They have two hundred acres of land,half of it is used for silage. They've got seventy fresian milking cows and thirty seven heifers to come into the milking herd.There are several other small farms which grow crops and keep small herds of cattle.
